snippet: A genetic examination of tarsiers indicates that the saucer-eyed primates developed three-color vision when they were still nocturnal.
abstract: Study in journal Proceedings of the Royal Society B suggests that primates' ability to see in three colors may have predated shift to daytime living, based on genetic examination of tarsiers, which are nocturnal.
lead_paragraph: A genetic examination of tarsiers indicates that the saucer-eyed primates developed three-color vision when they were still nocturnal.

headline.print_headline: Evolution: For Early Primates, a Night Filled With Color
headline.seo: Tarsiers Hint Primates Developed Color Vision at Night
headline.main: For Early Primates, a Night Filled With Color

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Proceedings of the Royal Society B
